ReviewContent: A great local bar with an awesome sense of community!I came here on a Wednesday night for the open mic night to support my friend's last performance. It's a small bar just a few blocks from the beach and has a fun beachy vibe to it!Will definitely have to come back again!
Best bar with an ocean view! Never a cover, live music on weekends with daily events.
Dude. I destroyed the Riptide. Number one out the back door in a fresh and clean environment. By the end of the night, some savage left a bloody maxi in the jawn but I was done pooping by then.

Taking the N-Judah out to Ocean Beach, I find myself walking south on the paved walkway along the Great Highway trying to avoid zealous joggers and bicyclists. Not easy given how rude some people like to get. By the time I get to Taraval, I'm ready to make a left and head back into the city.However, before I set off on my journey back, I sometimes make the very first stop available right here. But only after 3PM because that's when they open. It's a surprisingly large space for a tavern, but the wood paneling, brick fireplace sometimes with a roaring fire, and overall old timey vibe make it feel cozier.I'm usually on the early side, so it was just me and the lone bartender. I've ordered the $12 Mama P's Shaken Pina Colada which always surprises me to see a tiki drink way out on the edge of the Sunset (photo: https://yelp.to/b7CA2mNjqu). It's a mix of Malibu coconut rum, cream, and pineapple juice shaken and served over ice. Simple but quite tasty even on a brisk day.Recently I took advantage of their holiday menu and ordered the reassuring $12 Nutty Hot Chocolate with Baileys and Frangelico (photo: https://yelp.to/TuOAbfOK3M). My one takeaway here is that it's definitely a locals' hangout, so when they trickled in, I felt very much the outsider. If I came later for an event, I would think that might offset that isolated feeling.DRINKS - 4 stars...not the best tiki cocktail I've had but I like that they make itAMBIANCE - 4 stars...cozy, vintage feel offset by the exclusivity vibe from the regularsSERVICE - 4.5 stars...the bartender is always cordialTOTAL - 4 stars...a nice find way out westRELATED - Exploring the Sunset? Here's a collection of places I've tried and reviewed: https://bit.ly/2EI8eIJ
Such a cozy neighborhood bar. Great service and bingo was a lot of fun. Drinks are reasonably priced and they allow you to bring food in.

This place is must go local bar especially for Bingo on Saturdays. The vibes are always good, bartenders are efficient and have great recommendations. The bingo host is hella fun and they provide jello shots when calling 69 on bingo. It is dog friendly and you can bring pizza in from next door. The prize box is magical too if you win, but I cannot let the secret out. You have to go and find out for yourself.

We arrived a little after sunset (5:45ish), pulled up a booth, had a refreshing (& affordable $7!) beer, and rolled out ~6:30 when they were getting started with (free! with prizes!) bingo. We considered staying to play, but had a date with dumplings in our tracks :pThere were a few doggos in the bar, including one who had their own seat at the bar and was maybe the cutest thing I've seen all week (:The seats at the bar had one hook per seat to hang a jacket or bag (big plus/thoughtful consideration in my mind).Seems like plenty of events throughout the month (posted some photos of flyers hanging on walls as of 11/11/23). Bartender was friendly & efficient, with a good memory. Fun lil neighborhood watering hole! We'll def be back for bingo the next Saturday we catch a sunset at Ocean Beach.

Our FAVORITE dive bar in the Sunset!! My partner and I come here all the time, the bartenders are the BEST we loveeee Tara, Natalie & Molly!! The fellas are great too and the pours are always perfect! The ambiance is so cute if you're looking for a fun beach themed bar and the crowds are always fun. Entirely recommend!

Neat little neighborhood bar that attracts some amazing, young & talented musicians. A friend of mine brought me here to see a band he was considering joining as a guitar player. The crowd was chill, and they have a good selection of beers that were not all just IPAs - which is a disturbing trend in many bars today.Not this place, I have choices of beers.I'll be back even on nights without live music.
Oh I forgot to mention the lady who goes around with boot always has a smile on her face! The DJ has great support.Can DJ Damon do his 80s jam more than once a month ?

Had a blast at this place. My brother brought us here while we were visiting. We got to enjoy bingo night and had alot of fun. It was cool to learn about how they burned down an were rebuilt. If I lived in the area I could definitely see myself coming here alot. I especially enjoyed how we could get a pizza drop next door and eat it while drinking. Definitely a place to visit. Service was great and the bartender was very nice.
Great place for neighborhood hang out!  Nice bartenders, reasonable prices....its the Sunsets solution to gray skies!

Cute little retro bar near ocean beach. The service is horrible. In particular a person named " Tara". Even though she watched me walk in, it took her 20 minutes to wait on me at the bar. Rude and cold as ice despite my generous tip..which I regret. She had a group of friends at the end of the bar, that had her entire focus. The bouncer told me that she has been a problem.
the bouncers opinion was that I didn't look like the photo on my very real ID, so I unfortunately did not get to see this place. hopefully others will have a better experience

Have been coming here for years - friendly people, good drinks, a lot of variety day to day, often live music/free food, and good prices.  One disagreement with a comment below - MUNI doesn't go AWOL here any more often than elsewhere in the city; I depend on it.  Go ahead and grab the L-Taraval to get to Riptide, keep a taxicab return as your plan "B" if needed.

RIPTIDE has been around for decades. The quintessential SF Ocean Beach surf bar. Funky, Friendly, Fun. Definitely a Local hangout but new faces are welcome. Full bar. Some top shelf I'd you want it. Prices reasonable. Parking can be tricky. DON'T park illegally down here.

I LOVE this place on a Tuesday night when KJ Eileen is doing karaoke night!  Great vibes!  Love my bartenders Molly and Dugi!  Just crazy how this is the liveliest place in the city on a Tuesday all the way near the beach!

Yelp needs to remove anti-vax lunatics from review sections. They will ruin the app. The Riptide is a beloved San Francisco institution and deserves our patronage and support, especially since building back after the fire.

A friend of mine loves this place + all it's divey-ness. Unfortunately, I didn't get to experience the divey-ness because of it being closed due to COVID. However, they are doing cocktails to go and have outdoor seating. The outdoor seating is built as a parklet, which I'm always a little skeptical about because cars are still zooming by. However, on Taravel where The Riptide is, the street is closed so no worries about a car zooming by. But I still wasn't too comfortable with their outdoor seating arrangement. They have walls on 3 sides of their parklet and a roof meaning less airflow. I imagine it being because they're in the Outer Sunset and well it's cold there! But the tables overall were spaced out well and it looks like they have a smokers area too. So we decided to pay with Apple Pay and grabbed our cocktails to go and walked 2 blocks down to the beach and enjoyed the evening. The cocktails were either strong or I haven't had a cocktail in a while (likely the second). But well-priced. Service was at a window and she was super kind and didn't rush us at all. Would come back.

First time here and I have to say I absolutely love the vibe here. Pricing is reasonable, staff is friendly, it's pet friendly, and it is also a perfect place to enjoy a beer and watch the sunset with friends! The only drawback is that there are no heat lamps at the moment, so dress warm! We all know how this area gets when the sun goes down. With that in mind I definitely recommend this place!

Riptide has long been on my bucket list of bars - both for the location and the rapturous descriptions from friends. When they suffered the fire, I gladly gave, even though I'd yet to walk through their doors. This month, I finally made it, albeit during COVID, but still had a fine time. Their outdoor setup is safe yet cozy with its views of Ocean Beach's dunes. Prices are fair and staff are friendly. Tunes are playing over a sound system. It almost felt normal! When we're through this mess, I can't wait to walk through Riptide's doors, sit near the fireplace and enjoy some fine live music.

This is the best bar in San Francisco. The staff is one of a kind and it truly feels like you're a part of something bigger when you're there. They've adapted well to COVID safety procedures without losing their charm. Worth the trip.

My husband and I just stopped by this bar randomly and are so happy we did. We parked right in front of it and had ten minutes to spare while waiting for our take out across the street. I saw someone carrying a few beers from the door window and thought, "hey! Let's go support them and buy a drink for my mom (to go), who was waiting in the car!" It's honestly so refreshing to see such warm smiles during this horrific pandemic we are facing. The guy who greeted us and took our order and the window was super friendly and had such a positive attitude. Really easy and fun to chat with while we waited for the Bloody Mary. If you're in the area, stop by and support this neighborhood bar! Ps - this bar is super fun and I came here before COVID. Can't wait for it to reopen.
4 mile quarantine loop down to the ocean. Perfect day thanks to Riptide.  Drinks to go with straws!!
Cheap drinks, cash only, walked here from the zoo after it closed for happy hour and was not disappointed. killer bloody mary. would be back frequently if i lived closer.

This bar always feels like home. No matter who is behind the bar, the staff is always attentive and friendly. Whether it's a live band, DJ, or just bartender's choice, the music is always spot-on. After the fire, I was worried I might not get to drink here again. Ever since they re-opened, I've made sure to never take it for granted. It's the jewel of the Sunset, and as far as I'm concerned, the City.

OMG bartender refused serve drink Christmas night. I just want to buy my friend drink.Monday and Tuesday shouldn't go here bartender and security staff very stupid.I recommend you should go without Monday night and Tuesday night. Other days bartenders are very nice and professional.

I just moved to the sunset. And this bar is a five minute walk from my house. We stopped by on a bingo night after a beautiful sunset stroll on the beach. Everyone was ridiculously friendly and there was an awesome welcoming vibe. Who knew that bingo could be so fun?! Two whiskey sodas, and a Tito's soda was $21. $7 a cocktail? YOU CAN'T BEAT THAT. I took a bunch of photos of all the various theme nights they host. I am definitely coming back! Open Mic Monday's Karaoke TuesdayDJ every Friday Bacon Bloody Marys and Live Band on Sunday*Also note this bar is dog friendly.

Just went to this bar and Sharon was my bartender.  oh my goodness I've been here 100 times but she made it incredible. She's literally a bar genius. You can ask her to make anything. I am only going back if Sharon is bartending.
Great experience. Sharon hooked it up and took care of us all night. Neighborhood vibes, can't go wrong with riptide... I'll be back!!!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "The Riptide", "AuthorName": "Aisling D.", "AuthorLocation": "Outer Sunset, San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: I grew up in the Sunset, and have seen shows at the Riptide when I was younger. I was visiting home, and my friends and I took a taxi over from another bar where I and my friends had had one drink. Long story short: we walked in. I sat for 5 minutes alone waiting for a drink. My friend sat next to me for another 15 minutes; all together we were there for about 20 minutes and the bartender on purpose ignored us (with a great deal of eye contact) and kept serving other patrons first despite being there ahead of people. The bar back ignored us too. It was obvious they weren't going to serve us. We left.A. This is rude. B. This is judgmental. C. This is random. D. I won't be back. E. You're losing business. The door guy was nice, but this doesn't make up for completely dismissing customers on no basis on a Friday night.Lastly, we walked up to a bar on 33rd called The Four Deuces and they were happy to serve us and very friendly. ;)

Coming from out of town not knowing where to go Let me tell you if you're like me and staying close to this bar I highly recommend checking it out Cheap beer and Good beerGreat music and Great company Get a black an tan and sit back and Relax

I just came home from an open mic that I participated in. This was the second Monday, last Monday having played the Botanical Garden Piano event, a group of people I just met went there after. It was a blast. Charles, who leads the event, is the most helpful. I had an issue with the connector to my instrument, the iPhone. Honestly, I have no idea how I sound to others. I am usually nervous. It started at 8:30. A line forms in the middle of the room silently. You write your name in the book and you have 2 songs or ten minutes. Molly serves the booze. Every type of music gets sung/played. All skill sets. Everyone is friendly. If as one person said, she waited and waited, think of it as a blessing. You didn't have to pay. You got to take in the atmosphere free of charge. There is a therapy in waiting. Sometimes a bar is a form of therapy. Enjoy your life. Don't take yourself so seriously.I got to play my music, which I think is an addiction, and people were paying for drinks, and listening. Two people were nice enough to say nice things. What more can a person ask? I only have good things to say about The Riptide. "Can I pull out now?"
Cool bar, dope vibes and Jean is a super nice bartender that's light weight famous! Will definitely be back for Karaoke fun!

The bouncers here are great. They are friendly and will tell you what night it is--bingo, karaoke, country, etc. I usually come here after eating some pizza next door to use their bathroom and drink a quick beer.
Pretty cool vibe. Cash only. Sell cigarettes. Crowd is locals. What you see is what to get.

I came on a Tuesday night after work. I walked up to the bar and waited. And waited. And waited. The female bartender did not approach me even after we made eye contact. She kind of looked off and mumbled something to the bar-back. The bar-back saw me. Said nothing to the bartender. There was no one else waiting for a drink and only a few folks seated at the bar. She leapt up to serve a couple who approached the bar a few minutes after me. I thought, there's no way and no reason she shouldn't serve me. She must have... not seen me? Tried to give her the benefit of the doubt. But an older gentleman seated across the bar saw me. We made eye contact. I shrugged and smiled. He waved the bartender over, whispered something and pointed toward me. She said something back to him. Slowly turns with a hard eye roll that I couldn't miss, and drags her feet over to me. She approached me in a way that assured me she knew I was there the whole time. I ordered for the group of volunteers I invited to the bar who were seated at the table. I won't go into the details of how she took my drink order. I'm really puzzled. Was it the way I was dressed? Too formal? Ms. Bartender, I was respectful to you. I didn't wave you down. I paid and tipped. I live in the sunset and I will never invite friends to join me at Riptide as long as you're serving there. Usually don't write these things, but as a local and someone who's never been so poorly served and welcomed into an establishment, had to write this for others.

Easily the most fun & social bar on the West Side. Where other bars cater to narrow segments of the population, The Riptide pitches a 'big tent' (so to speak ;) for any & all thirsty wanderers. Whether it's Open Mike Mondays, raucous Friday happy-hours, Bar-Bingo Saturday nights, Country-Western Sundays or any other time, The Riptide is an *outstanding* place to take the pulse of SF's biggest beach-side community - while imbibing good, strong, reasonably priced alcohol, of course.Recommended!
Delightful neighborhood bar, they pour a good Guinness and they always have events going on like trivia, live bands, standups, etc.They also allow dogs, plus the staff is super friendly!

If you're looking for a friendly and welcoming, yet wonderfully divey bar out near the ocean, you're going to want to head to the Riptide.  After a day at the beach or if you're out in that general vicinity, you really can't beat it.They have live music, bingo, strong drinks, and dark decor.  I was worried for a while that they wouldn't open after the fire, but they did and they're just as glorious as ever! The bathrooms are about as clean as you could hope, and everyone is surly in that wonderfully dive bar way.  You don't feel unwelcomed, you just know your place as you warm your way in.This is a great place to hang your hat for a while.  Parking isn't too bad around the block, either.  Might take a second, but you won't be far away!

This place became a staple during my week stay in the Outer Sunset! It reminded me of home in a way, kind of like a divey Brooklyn bar. They also have board games, a nice crowd, and friendly bouncers. Overall fun place and definitely the best bar in the neighborhood.

I can't believe I haven't written about The Riptide yet! I feel so lucky to have this as my local bar, and I was heart-broken when it was burned down by a fire that started in a neighboring shop. The owners, Les and David, have done an outstanding job bringing back the homey, nostalgic feel of the original Riptide while adding some updates. The fireplace survived and is still a great place to cozy up when Karl the Fog is out and about. The drinks are cheap and generous. There is usually a special going on, and themed events like Bingo (the BEST) and karaoke (the WORST...in a good way). If you make it out the Western Edge of the World (aka the Sunset), make sure to add a stop at The Riptide!
Nice bartender and good atmosphere! Perfect when on vacation. Drink prices were great as well.

If you don't live in the neighborhood don't fucking come. This place is a casual, low key, hole in the wall that has a lot of potential. However I requested a song that I did not realize was a different version from what I am use to. I was ridiculed by both the bar staff and the DJ. The version I love is "live" and the menu did not specify that. I was only told after an embarrassing "omg you chose this" eh interview. And then it was ridiculed through the whole bar. I will never visit again.
Awesome dive bar with cool beach vibes. Good cocktails (according to my lady) at great prices. Lots of beers. No food. Glad they recovered after the fire. Great neighborhood spot.
Fireplace. Live music. Eclectic clientele. Rad staff. Beach a block away.The Riptide is a true diamond in the rough of the outer sunset. Hop on the L, head on out and have a good time.

Other than the lower prices on drinks, this place wasn't the greatest for a younger group of 3 people. The seating wasn't amenable for this number of people and the inside seemed claustrophobic. I am not that into dive bars though

The Riptide is the best neighborhood bar! Love Bingo on Saturday nights! When there is live music it livens the place up. Since the fire, the place has a Smokey smell that adds to the ambiance. Love the wood everywhere. All of the bar tenders are friendly and have a good time while working. Their happy hour specials are awesome! Love all of the events they put on, food drives and the ever so famous Polar Plunge on New Year's Day!

This is the most fun and by far most affordable bar in the Sunset. The bartenders are extremely nice and bingo night is always super fun! Locals are friendly and you can bring in outside food. It's a cool and clean dive bar. The only down side is that they are cash only but there is an ATM inside for a small surcharge. My fiancé and I came here right after he proposed!
DIVE in, best music in town. Reconstruction after fire is seamless from original, except the ships Captain painting is missing...

The Riptide is a great local dive bar located in the outer sunset. It's unsurprisingly crowded during the weekends. But, the service is quick. The vibes of the bar is a mixture of both young mid 20 y/o's to 50 y/o's. Another great addition to the bar is live music. It's a well rounded bar for a beach town.
Fun, down to earth bar with a super friendly bartender, and some cozy booths, but some really odd and a little off-putting patrons. Felt a bit like One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest.

Best neighborhood bar ever. Service is fast and friendly, cocktails are great. On a lucky night you get free potato chips. Bingo on Saturdays. Bacon Bloody Marys on Sunday are delish. Crowd always welcoming.

Good local bar. Tasty Bloody Mary although we did not have the bacon because they do that on Sunday's. We were staying at an air bnb up the street. We went back but they had a wedding reception going on, like I said a great local bar. Go if you are in the area!

I was there for the first time on a Sunday eve after Hardly Strictly Bluegrass. Loved that there was  live music all night!  Great beer too. Small neighborhood dive-type bar but recently rebuilt.  Nice, new. Beach town, love the ocean scent in the air.

Really fun place. Great service, reasonably priced drinks, fairly clean, and lots of fun events. It's also close to the beach and public transit. It is cash only, so be ready for that, and I wouldn't recommend going on Bingo night unless you're into that (it gets super loud), but otherwise I have no complaints.

I don't drink often but once in a while I will stop in for a scotch on the rocks. Here is my take on The Riptide:Good service (thanks Michelle) for sure. Clean and fairly well stocked. Very divey but that's okay with me. Big projection TV screen set up and good music. $9/single of Macallan 12 and you're gonna wanna just get it neat and ask for a cup of water with extra ice because on the rocks it's less than a single lol. My double felt more like a single at the end of it. Huge downside: Cash only. ATM in the joint but a $3 surcharge. Upside: next to public transportation and of course Brothers Pizza.

Best bar ever.  The staff is exceptional - each and every one of them.  It feels like a home away from home.   Familiar faces, low-key fun.  Really rebounded excellently after the tragic fire that took it away from us.  Going in on a Friday night is often one of the only things that gets us through the week.  It really feels like family.  Lots of special events : music, burlesque.  Only problem ?  Weekly bingo doesn't happen anymore.  Bring that back, and you will have absolute perfection.

Fun local dive bar. This bar was rebuilt after it burnt down in a fire.You definitely get the feel that this is where the locals in the sunset come. The theme inside is pretty nice. There are mounted animals on the walls and a fireplace that has a fire going.They have live music as well sometimes. Make sure to bring cash, since the bar is cash only. There is an ATM inside the bar if you need to use it. This place is fun for a low key evening.There is no food served here.Plenty of parking on the street, or the rail line drops off and picks up on the street.

Found this place quite by accident while staying down the street in a motel.  What a great place.   A very friendly dive bar that pours a great drink.  Good conversations and advice on place around the area.  Plus I can take my dog in with me.  Brothers Pizza is just 3 doors down and you can bring in food.  Lots of times at happy hours the bar has free snacks.   Some times they have music or play bingo.  It is somewhat quite early, but it can get real busy on bingo night.  Never had a bad time here.  Highly suggest it.

The riptide is a truly amazing local bar. When it burned down two summers ago, it was truly a tragedy. Thank goodness that the owners were able to raise the funds to rebuild - it's so good to have it back.The best part about the riptide is that it is totally un assuming.  You can be anyone, be going for any reason, and feel at home here. Yes, there are hipsters, yes there are surfers, yes there are punk people, yes there are old men, yes there are your classic day drinkers, yes there are students, yes there are nerds - really - you do fit in here.Other things about the riptide that are great:- They serve free food during their happy hour (5-7 weekdays). No it's not fancy. But really, who doesn't love chips with nacho cheese sauce out of a crock pot?- The beer is not $8 or $10 a pint. I think it's like $6 for a Lagunitas.- They have both light beer and craft beer. Again - you DO fit in here.- They have a fireplace. Yes, you heard me right - a fireplace. And no, not a fake one - the real kind that you put wood on. And yes, you can sit next to it.- They have a TV and you will find your local sports fan friends there at the appropriate moments.Cons:- uh there really aren't many- It's too clean since the remodel?- Verizon doesn't get good service inside? (this might actually be a pro - who wants to get a phone call while enjoying happy hour anyways?)- It's kinda small? Love the Riptide.
Stopped by last night for a much needed drink after a long day, Noah, the bartender, was super friendly and helpful! Love this place!!!

I use to go there before the Fire happen in 2015, to hear my friend Ken Owen play the drums, on a Sunday. The service is okay, the prices are fair, its,at the end of my street gotta love that in walking distance!

The Riptide is back from the ashes!  The fire may have closed the bar down for a year and destroyed the decor, but it is back and better than ever!  The amazing staff is ready to serve a delicious bacon Bloody Mary, a expertly made Manhattan on the rocks, or a perfect pint of Guiness.  It is still the place to meet your neighbors and friends or make new ones so, run, don't walk to The Riptide.

I miss this place!! Deceptively large, great jukebox selections. Bartender was great. Fun atmosphere. Locals were so receptive and warm, not like other bars I've been to in SF. I hope this place makes a comeback!!
Sadly, I began going to the Riptide a few months before the fire.  Awesome vibe and by far the best bar in the Sunset.  I cannot wait for it to re-open, holla.

Always loved bingo Saturdays. Looking forward to hearing O 69 and getting free jello shots Well mix of young and old. I just hope they have a bit better selection of high end spirits like single malt, bourbons, and maybe even a calvados. Looking forward to going on my 50th next month. Drink priced always good.

My husband and friends and I have been coming to the Rip Tide since it opened. We even came here when it was the Sand Bar and before that the Oar house. However since it has been the Rip Tide, it has been a weekly home away from home for my friends and I. Since the fire, we have simply been lost without our cozy booth, and our bartender friends and neighbors that we see regularly. We support you and miss you terribly.

It's a shame about the fire, this place was a great little bar stuck far enough out in the Sunset to keep it off the radar a bit.  The bingo games always got the place collectively going, and all of the sudden some dude next to you is your new best friend bc now you have a common goal (other than wasting the day away on a barstool.)  The bartenders know how to pour a drink and really don't take any BS. There always seemed to be a wave (pun!) of young weekend bar hoppers that appeared and kind of ruined it for a while, but they usually left soon enough.A very good drinker's bar.

Read about bingo here on Saturday nights and a few friends and I decided to give it a whirl.  It is free and starts at 6:00pm.  Space can be a bit tight, so arrive early to grab a spot.  There are 3 rounds with a few minutes in between. Parking was a breeze!  If you're looking to grab a bite to eat near by, you're going to have to look pretty hard if you're not into pizza/pasta/Indian (all in one restaurant).  The bar staff is pretty and accommodating if you're new to the joint like we were and aren't quite sure where to situate yourself when there are no tables left.  Service seems pretty quick too!Bingo is spirited and the whole bar gets into it.  The best part is the jell-o shot when O 69 is called!I'll be back when I'm in the area or need something fun a cheap to do!

Came here last Thursday afternoon after a walk on the beach and had a wonderful time. The bartender- I believe her name was Adaline- really went above and beyond, recommending drinks and making a very enjoyable atmosphere. Also they had DIY sandwiches- so clever! I would highly recommend this cute little neighborhood dive bar.

The Riptide is a great neighborhood bar. It's not a fancy cocktail lounge, it's not a Michelin starred restaurant - it's an honest, no-frills bar in one of the few working class neighborhoods left in San Francisco. If you're expecting to have your ass kissed you should head back to SOMA. If you want a good drink and no bullshit, with a great 70s rock soundtrack, come here on Thursday for Adaline's happy hour shift.

Great dive bar, right by the ocean with killer sunsets right outside. My dog Mako always has a blast, usually with another dog friend or two, and excellent bartender service! Always surprised at some of the people's comments -- I guess they've never been to a dive bar before, or don't know how to act if someone isn't kissing their asses all night. They should probably stick to their hipster-spots in the mission or whatever. Was there just this last Thursday with literally ZERO complaints! I'm usually outta here by 8 or 9 to miss the evening crowd, but the cool atmosphere and good times from 4-9 is always a winner. Good prices, good whiskey.

I struggled with the stars on this one. Most of the time I go there and it's comfortable, queer friendly, and has a home town divey time.  But with what happened recently I probably won't go back.The Thursday of the Warriors playoff games my girlfriend and I went to watch the game at 5pm ish.  It was on the big screen but with no sound (???)  And then I asked the bartender if it would be alright to bring in slices of pizza from next door.  (PS I waited 5 minutes standing at the uncrowded bar while she was texting someone)  She glared at me and literally barked "As long as you clean up after yourselves" and kept glaring at me.  She was so hostile that the people sitting at the bar looked up in shock.  I was in shock myself and to keep from saying "Well, you know it is hard for me to clean up after myself or even eat in public especially since I'm only 35 years old..." I just paused and laughed uncomfortably.  WTF.  Meanwhile there was a nasty little table with cold cuts and bread that people could eat that they had to dip their hands in.  WTF x2.We left at half time and went to Parkside Tavern where the SF citizens with a pulse were watching the game and celebrating.

Could definitely be my favorite bar in the city.  Absolutely out of the way from me but nothing makes me happier than heading out towards the beach for some music, some drinks and a good seat at the bar. Everybody knows each other, great prices for the city, dogs welcome... a great spot.

This place is definitely a find. On a Friday night, it was filled with locals who seemed to know each other, a bartender who was speedy but not curt, and some pasta salad and chocolate cake on the house. No hipsters, no techies, no gleaming white buses, no endless bike racks, no $7 beers. Just a big screen showing the Giants game, people getting along and having a good time, and lots of street parking. Gosh, I almost forgot how going out in San Francisco used to feel.

I went to the Riptide this past Friday night for a little late night drink and Mike Gerendasy was my bartender.  He was very friendly, made me a very tasty cocktail and even went as far as to introduce me to folks sitting around me because I was there alone.  Mike has to be one of the best bartenders in the City...I will definitely be back when he is working!! The Riptide is a great neighborhood bar even though it isn't in my neighborhood!!

Bingo Saturday nights with locals = guaranteed good time! Jenny the bingo lady is awesome, drink prices are great, cute dogs allowed :) and crowd is chill. Also bingo lady's boot sister is a hottie.Apparently there's karaoke as well!

I live in this area so it is great as a neighborhood bar and every night during the week they serve food. The great thing for me is that it is mostly locals so you get to meet a lot of people who live in this area. As far as the sunset district goes most of the bars are dive bars but other than the riptide they are all full of old men. Great drinks, cool people, and wet Wednesday's. That is when they show surf movies usually shot at ocean beach and every third Wednesday they used to raffle off a brand new board.

I spent a foggy Wednesday night here, drinking cokes and eating Doritos with my visiting sister. The music was so weirdly excellent - try Norah Jones sandwiched between Minor Threat and Ministry - that I knew I was in a special place. Then a bartender in a 'namaste motherfucker' t shirt slapped some pens and napkins onto our table and told us to draw something for their weekly sketch contest. When my sister said we were leaving, the bartender called bullshit and said 'you've been sitting here all night, you're not leaving.' And so we drew really bad Jasper Johns and Andrew Wyeth knock offs to comply with the 'American modern artists after 1920' sketch contest rule that night. This bar is really fun. They have bingo and karaoke and with the wooden interior and all the nautical decor and taxidermy and activities it feels like camp. Not that I've ever been to camp.
This place is cool to hang out with a few friends after work. Love their drink specials and honestly some of the friendliest staff I have ever met at a bar, and in general.

I went here a ton during the six years or so that I lived in the neighborhood, mostly because it was great to be able to walk to blocks to the bar and not worry about how I was getting home. The place is not big, but there's usually plenty of people there to socialize with. I definitely saw a few "altercations" there over the years, but for the most part it's a very chill place to hang out and grab a few drinks. For what is is -- a dive bar in a neighborhood full of surfers -- it works extremely well. The only reason I don't give it five stars is that I wasn't ever a fan of the bands that played there. They've got plenty of other events going on every week though.

I LOVE the atmosphere of this place. Super cute and cozy but just as divey. They always have something going on each night and have bands come in to play frequently. The only con is that I wish the service was better. I typically have to wait 5-10 min for a drink. It's still one of my favorite bars in the sunset.

O69!!!!!There are dive bars, and then there are dive bars. Usually dive bars are... well just dive bars... but THIS is an AWESOME dive bar. It's near the ocean side of San Francisco, so I got super lucky, and it was insanely easy to find parking... unlike in the Sunset... or some other crazy part of town. If you look over yonder, you can see Ocean Beach! Wooooooooo.I was excepting... well... divey... but this. This place is homey; yes it's small (there are two parts to the bar which is divided by... well the bar), but even when it was a little crowded, it didn't feel that bad. The only thing I felt bad for were the dogs people were bringing into the bar... like people please... dogs? In a bar? Where they're at ground level and drunk people can't see and step on them? :/ Poor doggies... plus it's loud and kind of rowdy... so I imagine them getting kicked around a little bit.Drinks are cheap, but I didn't come here for drinks that night. I came here... for BINGO. Bingo, you say? The old people's game? No. This bingo is awesome bingo. Riptide does Bingo on Saturday nights at 6 pm. We were late, so we only got to play the last round out of three total rounds (come early because sometimes the rounds finish quickly), but it was still awesomely fun. It was a blackout round, so you had to blackout all the squares. The emcee was hilarious (pretty sure he made the game); drinking with the patrons, telling funny jokes, and he was super nice and let us play the last round.Here's the thing about this bingo. Everytime they get the O69 ball... EVERYONE and I mean EVERYONE who is playing the game, gets a free jello shot! How's that for advertising. Makes the game pretty fun and everyone's obviously in a great mood.Love the decor, there's carpet in some places... which seems like it would get really gross, but it wasn't, there's a random fireplace too in the back! Seemed to have enough space for the people in the bar... and I didn't feel too claustrophobic inside.Definitely on my list to make it back to. So much fun! Oh also, don't forget. This place is cash only! So bring moola!

i'd a gave that dj my last dimeit's great how this city truly offers a wide array of nitelifeyou want dive, beer pong, red carpet, edm, fratty, its somehwere you want lodge like you got it here.  my id and super ego after a few jamesons can run snoop like or toby keith esqueyea they're extremities as i can picture myself draped in gold bouncing to hydrolics in an el camino or waving to folks in wranglers in a dodge hemi...then i wake up the next day and realize i'm late for munithat mounted moose is the bees knees as ill drink to that massive pointer.  unexpected and good times here at the riptide

You know that place in Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy -- the last bar at the end of the universe?  That's what I think of when I come to Riptide.  Venture out to the Outer Sunset on Taraval past West Portal, past 19th Ave., past Kingdom of Dumplings and Marcello's, past Sunset Blvd., and you will come to where San Francisco ends -- the Pacific Ocean.  And right before that, a stone throw away, is this little bar.  It's the perfect place to huddle up with friends and just let the time stand still.

Love this neighborhood bar! I came here on Saturday night for Bingo Night (YES, bingo night. ) It was a full house. We manage to find a high table and got free bingo cards. The pregnant lady calling out the number was hilarious and kept the mood fun. At O 69, the whole bar got free jello shots. Drinks were super cheap here and have the usual domestic beers. There's a juke box in the corner if that tickles your pickle.

Came to hear Jinx Jones play rockabilly recently, my first time at the Riptide. The beach is two blocks away, I loved hearing the surf while nearing the place. The tavern has two doors and seems like it may have been two separate spaces at some time or other, united by the bar. Drinks can be ordered from either side. I was very impressed by not having to wait long to order and receive my beer each time, despite the place being quite crowded. Also liked that I could talk to and hear my friends, the music wasn't deafening. Was further impressed by the diversity of the crowd: old, young, a table of lesbians, loners, dogs, definitely a few rockers. What a great place!
Always free Always funLove the Rip and the StaffBest Bar in the Surfers Sunset
Still a 5.  seems like they maybe cleaned up a bit.  have not noticed the smell the last few times in there. . .. . .still a must-do spot if you have never been.

Just happened to stumble into this place since I had some time to kill while waiting to pick up the lady from work nearby.  I was pleasantly surprised.  Between the large screen with the hockey game on, the punk rock jukebox, and the dog-friendliness I was hook.  It basically felt like home.  I've made it a point since then to stop there at least once a week with the lady and the pooch.  Oh...and the bartenders are welcoming and really friendly.
Pulp Fiction Soundtrack on the jukebox and a helluva bacon bloody! ! Rock on!!

Cool lil spot with  alot of things going on within the week and a nice lil list of drinks. I tried em all they're all good. In fact the crowd was soo nice there I had people buying me drinks.  The bartenders are great , no matter how loud it gets it seems like they can hear what you requested without you even having to yell and no matter how busy it gets they give you excellent service. It was packed and I didn't have a hard time ordering my drinks at all.  The karaoke gets pretty happening here on tuesdays. Theres a nice variety of people in here. No clicky types , everyone seems to make me feel welcome. There seems to be a big college crowd here. I also find it to be a great place to watch the game. gotta check out the drink specials from 4-7, but they also have specials for the certain days of the week that last all night too.  The food is delish.

As with most of the Sunset bars, this is not for hipsters or amateurs. One of the greatest jukeboxes in the city. Great beer selection. Great bartenders and great music. The only bar in the city you can enjoy slide guitar as well as real beach music. With one of the best pizza joints in the city right next door, you just can't go wrong here.

Wel love this bar.  If we are in San Francisco we always hit the Riptide.  All the bartenders are friendly and the clintes welcoming.  We live in Fort Bragg CA and only get to San Francisco a couple times a year.  But the bartenders ALWAYS remember our preferred drinks and our names.  Week nights they often have "Happy Hour" food.  But you can always bring a snack of your own.  Well stocked bar and they know how to make a martini.  I would recommend the "Bacon Bloody Mary"served in a pint jar with bacon bits on the rim... Miss Jean makes a mean one on Sundays, and since I prefer Gin over vodka, she is happy to make the change and never questions me.  If we have our dog "Miss Dixie Dalmatian" with us, she always gets a strip of bacon herself.  Some nights they have events that are always fun.  But any day is a good day at the Riptide.
Bingo Saturday is a lot of fun, awesome fireplace, great dive bar!
I'm new to San Francisco and it was great to go somewhere where everyone is friendly, the music is good and the bartenders serve promptly. I'll be coming back for sure.

Fun bar but last Tuesday when I went down for Karaoke Tuesdays someone picked up my leather jacket and left me theirs. Try to get it back but don't know how :( if you see this respond or at least tell the bar tender there what happened. I would really really appreciate it. That leather jacket has a lot more sentimental value that you think.

This is the nearest bar to my apartment, so I occasionally mosey on over to hear the Hillbilly Hootenanny West Side Review.  They sound amazing.  I never thought I would think that of country music, but truly, this band is good.  As for the bar, it's cash only with an ATM inside.  It gets crowded, but not too bad.  Nice, convenient dive bar.

I can't count the times I've staggered out of Riptide after a rip-roaring good time and somehow made it onto Muni AND stopped for Seniore's, girlfriends in tow. If you're looking for a fun, neighborhoody divebar to head to on a weeknight, look no further than Riptide. Drinks are strong, staff is friendly, and they usually have *FREE* nachos or hot dogs (eat at your own risk, but I've never had a bad experience) to soak up some of the strong drinks you'll most likely be sappin' on during the queue for Karaoke. Oftentimes there's live music and the spot has a homey kind of feeling to it: a bunch of people who know each other, or you're with someone who knows other people, or you're a stranger and go to bars alone, either way, you will likely be able to find someone who will converse with you.

I reside here (Outer Sunset) and love this bar! Not a big drinker, just love the neighborhoodeee vibe, and how eclectic the people are here...the young to the kinda older set. Woman at the bar has it going on in terms of very pleasant, plus quick and efficient!  Hip w/out being tragically so...
Fan-flipping-tastic!  We saw Gypsy Moonlight tonight and they were Exactly right. Lots of love!
This place is cool to hang out with a few friends after work. Has free nachos and cheap beer. 3 premium beers for $12. Not to bad if you ask me

This place rules. A quick hop, skip and a jump away from the beach and you'll be in an authentic beachy cool bar. The decor is interesting and not cluttered. It's clean inside, but not hoity toity. The tables? Maybe my favorite part of the bar. They are made of thick slabs of beautiful wood. Unfortunately, I didn't get to see a show here. However, next time I'm in town it'll be a must.Cash only for drinks here. The beer list will satisfy any palate and they are reasonable priced. AND, they have free snacks... which included tator tots when I was there!
Love this little bar, good music. $2 PBR, snacks with happy hour, karaoke night once a week, and dog friendly.

Place is awesome! It's off the grid really close to the beach. Definitely a local bar with interesting patrons. Bingo night is a lot of fun. Jenny who is also a friend of mine calls it Saturday night. Comes with free Jell-O shots (who wouldn't want that). The decor is very unique. It reminds me of a classic log cabin living room with a bar of course. The drinks are really cheap and made well. Riptide is a must go!

Scummy dudes what don't take no for an answer. Should be one star but the staff is really nice and cool. Quick drinks and really helpful with telling drunk guys to leave girls alone. Are willing to be the bad guy to help you out. Thanks riptide bartenders!

Love this place...  a real neighborhood bar in the best possible the sense... meaning you get a cross-section of the people that live in this whacky-ass neighborhood. Surfer dudes, poor hipsters, older people, and dogs -- come one, come all.There's a fireplace (which is more appropriate on this beach-for-suckers than a beach blanket).There's live music a lot.  Could be good.I saw some swing dancing once (and it wasn't in the 90's).You'll feel transported -- I'm just not sure where to.

Was at Riptide with a group of friends during a night of bar hopping. This sleezy douchebag slipped his hand around me and would not leave me the hell alone after telling him off. When the bartender saw she stepped in and escorted the a-hole away. I left about 10 seconds after that with my friends following and they told me that the bartender was super nice about it and apologetic as we were leaving. Definitely going back to thank her personally for being so awesome about that! She made a bad situation go away fast and I'm extremely grateful for that.Also, the place makes fantastic mixed drinks and is really generous when it comes to shots. Not to mention that that bartender calls everyone "honey" and that's super cute.

I like the beer selection and ambiance here. There's also some pretty great events like movie screenings and such here. The only downside to this place is that it's pretty small and gets packed easily. Parking is also a hassle, but it's not a bad place to chill and have a beer with some weird surfing movie on the big projector. Their tables are pretty cool, too. They're shaped like driftwood and can fit a small group.

I went here on 12-3-13 around 9:30pm.  I ordered a lagunitas ipa $5 and noticed there was a little green price list (certain draft beers were also $5--also purchased a guiness, and heineken was $4). There were 2 girls promoting "Wild Turkey whiskey" with coke samples to the patrons, I had two and also gave me a keychain with bottle opener.  This bar really have good prices on their beers.  Eileen the kj was throwing the gig and was able to sing all the songs I requested, she has a thorough selection (I sang Lenny Kravitz's "Fly Away", Marvin Gaye's "What's Going on?, Earth Wind and Fire's "September" + "Let's Groove", and Prince's "Popllife"+"I would die for you". The speaker system is better than decent/I didn't have yell in the microphone. There was a moderate/young crowd,  definitely into the scene.

Oh, I get it -- it's called The Riptide because it's close to the coast! Very clever, very clever.This is one bar that complements the area nicely. Get away from the cold, foggy banks of Ocean Beach and warm up with a roaring fireplace and the game going on overhead. It's a come-as-you-are style of bar, one where the beer flows like wine and even the dogs can take a seat.

Riptide certainly has an interesting culture, an attempted nautical theme and dark wood paneling makes it a typical, middle class neighborhood bar. The atmosphere is warm and friendly, space kept clean and the staff warm, friendly and helpful.I would probably go back again.
Fun divey bar out in the outer, outer. Bartenders can be a bit unfriendly, but unique place in SF.

Bingo Saturdays are the shizz.Love their drink specials and honestly some of the friendliest staff I have ever met at a bar, and in general.This place can be a real turn off if you're parochial and only drink high-end vodkas and spirits. Lots of a beer on tap. Lots of interesting drink concoctions like coffee flavored vodka and baileys, as a shooter. Absolutely tasty and for only 6 bucks, it sure gives you a kick!I don't know what else to say but this place is just so down to earth and so welcoming that it makes me want to come here everyday so I too, can become a regular. I am by no means a regular to this place, but I will say that my first time here, they treated me as one. They were welcoming, not judgmental, as I was- for sure -the ONLY Asian in this place, and just down right a fun bunch of people.What other place gives you free Jell-O shots during Bingo when the coveted O-69 gets called? What other place have regulars that bring in food for the whole bar to eat? And what other bar at times has bacon flavored popcorn?I give the Riptide 5 stars, for all of the above.

Was told this bar was dog friendly. Brought my dog, dog was attacked by another dog then I was asked to leave because the other dog was ownd by a regular patron. moral is don't bring your dog unless they are 100% submissive to more vicious dogs.

My friends and I came here Saturday for bingo night. We got there around six and the place was already packed. I would suggest coming earlier if you want to grab seats. Luckily for us, a couple let us share a table with them. But don't worry if you don't have seats, they can provide you with a clipboard if you want to play bingo. Three rounds of bingo. A winner from each round wins a prize. The last round's reward is a $50 bar tab, which I think it very worth it if you win it. The entire bar gets excited as the rounds progress. Everyone also gets a free Jell-O shot if O69 is called. Unfortunately, none of us won anything that night, but I still had fun playing and chatting with my friends! This is a chill environment to grab good and cheap drinks. The staff is inviting and friendly as well. Because it is so close to where I live, I would come back to this place.

I absolutely love coming here! Bingo is what usually brings me in, but it's also great for grabbing a drink or two (or five) with friends.  Bingo on Saturday nights is always a blast, and that's considering that I have yet to win here.  Bartenders are friendly and know how to make a good drink.  The general ambience reminds me of the random, divey country bars I've been to in the Central Valley and the infamous Elkhorn in San Miguel, but that's probably what I love most about this place.  It embraces the divey-ness without being one of those sticky-floored, dingy, crusty dive bars, and that's what makes this place truly great.  If you're in the Sunset and want to have a great drink and a great time to go along with it, check out The Riptide.

The place is chill. The live music can bring it up a couple of notches as the performers are always really into it. Go ahead and take the L alllll the way out there...then grab some brothers pizza and chill at the beach. Always a good night

This is a crusty joint.  The PBR flows in golden showers amidst rivulets of cheap whiskey, the bartenders have a few miles under their eyes, and the karaoke options include vaguely racist David Bowie songs.*  I can't wait to go back.*I don't condone racism, and the staff is in no way racist, but hearing someone drunkenly belt out "China Doll" is a sight to see.
disappointed. Met with 3 friends & was so excited to see them. Bar was too noisy-(small area) hard to hear people. good thing, bar is pet friendly-saw 2 dogsJane D

Being that I don't really drink - going out to bars has a different appeal for me.If I'm going out to a bar or lounge - I like to make sure it either has great ambiance,  some pretty fabulous people at it, or some  quality live music.The Riptide has all of that.It's one of the most charming and cozy bars in all of San Francisco.It's got a rustic inviting atmosphere - which is so fitting - considering it's right by the breeze of the beach. As you enter and leave you can smell the salt water in the air. Bliss.The Riptide's bartender are unbelievably on top of things.The whole time I was here  - their main lovely bartender made sure that my water was constantly refilled (despite there being a self pour station). Each time he - added fresh wedges of lemon as well. So refreshing! It was open mic night and from the moment I entered - everyone at Riptide was kind. The older Irish gentleman sitting next to me at the bar had such a warm demeanor. He talked lovingly about his grown children. All of Riptide was bubbling with kind-eyed regulars - many of whom were there for the open-mic. Everyone was supportive of all of the musicians and just happy to be out and surrounded by friendly faces. My long walk to the beach was so well rewarded by an epic evening here - full of the nicest and most personable bar regulars and staff around. I can't wait to spend more epic evenings here.Trust.

This is my local go to bar. Especially Mondays with open mic and $3 Widmer's till midnight. Tuesday are also my fav day to go because the have karaoke it always ends up going till 2am and everyone usually picks some good songs to sing along to:). And Thursdays is lady's night! I really enjoy this bar and it's close to beach!

went there last night,not enough bar staff,only one serving 300 people,the owner could have sold double the amount of drink if he had 3 bar staff on,there was a 20 minute wait for a drink,prices are high for a dive bar,5 dollars for a steller,,people are friendly,the bar man was friendly,i find the bar women thatr usully works there not friendly,toilets could be cleaned more,theres only 2,so expect a line,its a long way outso not many yuppies go there,quite dark and dingy bar not the cleanest,its a good local bar

My wildly talented SF-based friend told me this was one of the best open mics in town, so on a recent work trip I ducked out for a couple hours, raced across Twin Peaks to the beach and found myself in one of those places that feels like home. Kind, cool, no BS staff signed me up to play and got me on stage for the two song max bonanza that was going down. Everyone who played went whole heartedly all in, something about the fireplace, the piano, the grit, the wide age range, the inclusive blue collar sideways smile of it all... After I played, tough funny Irish men bought me whiskey and told me stories and I didn't want to ever leave.

Try living out in the Sunset or Parkside and suddenly you will see how important this bar is.It is better than all the others way out here.  It is.  Really.It is cozy.  It is neighborhoody.  They have some decent beers and it tastes like they clean their lines.   They always have a drink special and not always something you wouldn't want.  They have bands.  They have bingo and all sorts of other game/hang nights. They have a fireplace.

The Riptide is a great Sunset dive bar -  decent delection of micro-brews, friendly bartenders and patrons. Fireplace and projection TV showing sports are  added bonuses. For happy hour they usually have some sort of snanks such as nachos, grilled cheese, or hot dogs for soaking up the booze. Best thing was that there was not a 'hipster' in sight

This place has got character.  And I love places with character.  More than once I've mused as to how I could sneak one of those lacquered tables out of this joint!  And did I mention, there's  a deer head on the wall... a deer head!  ha!  Or what, Is is a moose?  Too many beers!  I would recommend going when there's live music.  *Highly recommend.  The bartenders are super cool too!  Cash only, but there's an ATM.

Riptide is like how a bar should be. Warm and welcoming with good people around you. The drinks are great! The bartenders know what you want. When you walk into the bar, you feel like you've been around the world. They have soo many beautiful antiques. But I must say that the two things that got me about this bar, was the audio sound in the main room and decor that surround the walls.. If you want to hear good audio sound in a bar, go to the Riptide. There are seats in front of the fireplace. one of my favorite spots!

I had a charming Sunday night here, what a little gem! Could not have been happier. Walked in with a friend to live music of cowboys and country (they had a slide guitar, guys!) and enjoyed the performances as the band called various regulars up to sing or song or two each. Some were amazingly good, others less so... but all were entertaining. I really meant to find out the name of the mother/daughter duet duo. They were incredible!The bartenders were on it and the place was soon filled. Bathrooms, your standard o-k bar experience.The crowd was varied and unpretentious, from old cowboys, hipsters, frat guys and the the like. I couldn't believe I was in SF! Will definitely be back.Thanks Riptide!

Really liked this bar, it was right next to Ocean beach and had a nice friendly feel to it.They had live music and decor to match to boot. Really felt like a bar you could be a regular at if you were a local. I liked that they had history on the wall, and even had a quote to the effect of, "welcome to the edge of the western world" I am a sucker for adventurous type of culture tid bits. Had a couple good conversation, wish they had pirate music.I miss authentic pirate music.

I'm not sure if it was because there was no live music that night, but the ambiance was sort of dead.  It was still loud due to the music in the background.  I felt like I was in the south again, which was interesting, but I'm not feeling the bartenders there.  The drinks were fairly cheap though and strong like how I like it.  I will give it another try when there's actually music.

I really like this small little, home-like place.  I wish they had real food and more people during happy hour.  The regulars seem friendly, but could be more welcoming to newbies.  I haven't been to a music night yet.

This place is great! Right next to NorCal and Pacifica Beach (Linda Mar), this is the local spot to go to enjoy some great food at a very cheap price. The food is great, try their crepes, they are all pretty good. It can be busy at times, but it's worth trying it. The only weird thing about this restaurant is that you make your order at the entrance and then sit yourself.... This is the place I often go after a surf session at Pacifica.

Awesome hole-in-the-wall surfer's bar. I'd recommend cabbing it out here because Muni has been known to go M.I.A. in this part of the Sunset.Live music, bartenders who know what they're doing and don't patronize. Cheap, cheap, cheap beers.The bathrooms are as expected, smelly and full of kegs. This place is great for a casual night of drinking and nobody to impress.

A cozy, fun little dive bar that really just is what it is. Good drinks, comfy, friendly (in my experience) bartenders. Stop in and enjoy it if you have the chance! But bring cash: no cards and, personally, I don't enjoy paying large ATM fees.
The bartender is a METS fan.. a plus, also great atmosphere and great shows. The only downer was this fratboy sitting behind me grousing about the band asking for a contribution.. what a jerko.

Came out here with my roomies on a Friday afternoon for a drink and the place was packed.  They were serving free pasta and bread for everyone to have which I thought was really cool. This is a cash place only so make sure you bring enough with you. I would definitely come back and will become a regular. Good music , low key crowd, what a great place to be after a long days of work or a relaxing day at the beach.

unpretentious, cheap, kitschy, fun. i'm comfortable going there by myself where the people are friendly but don't over stay their welcome. i'm usually the only non-irish person there but it's never an issue. all of the bars along taraval seem to have a disproportionate amount of men in them and this one is no different but i feel safer here than at others along this strip. tip: bring some cash. they don't take cards and their atm charges $3.

LOVE! this dive bar... Walked down with my roomies last night for a couple pints-2 stars for the decor- really old random swag, a fireplace, a moose, a plethora of old timey photos and the register straight from the wild west(snowboarding videos projected on a giant screen- nice touch)1 star for the dj- played lots of punk, reggae and funk... and looked like Dante from grandma's boy lol1 star for the service- it was packed but the sole bartender was on top of itVerdict: a badass neighborhood pub with flavor, I'm smitten

Great place. Sunset's very own Cheers. We showed up out of the blue just in time for Bingo on a Saturday night. Then we sat by the fire for an hour and moved so the band could set up. We stopped by for one drink and stayed for 3 hours. Lots of people had pizza from the place next door. Everyone was having such a great time. Loved it.
just a great bar with a great laid-back vibe perfect after a long day at the beach

Funky divey beach bar. Interior looks like it is rural Michigan. Lots of crusty creepy locals and then on some nights the SF State girls show up and cheer it up a lot. It's usually very entertaining to visit for a short stopover.

A really chill bar that has bingo night, pretty funny actually.Its located near the beach and something about this place feels really relaxing. Especially the tables/booth. This place gives me the same comfortable feeling I had when I was just chilling at a bar in Taiwan. Beer and laptop...the only difference is that I can't smoke at Riptide.
Best place to go on a Mon night. Feels like your out of SF. Fireplace, great bartenders, local drunks, friendly people.

DIY yourself ladies night grilled cheese warrants driving out to 46th street (it's not underwater! The streets DO go that far).Yummy grilled cheese, cheap cheap $3.50 beer, really nice bartender (she said bye to us, and I got confused.. that NEVER happens), and a FIREPLACE. Yay, yay, yay :)Brooke says I should give them 5 stars, but I think she should make her own yelp profile and stop questioning my star giving scale.

Sometimes when I get out I get WAY out! The Riptide is so close to the beach that you can hear the friggin' Waves!WHOA!THE PLACE HAS SOME AWESOME DJs! the place is small and quaint. the drinks are standard. the dudes are dull, the babes are better than you would think.I have rocked and sexed tin this club and you could too if you knew what you were doing!
Nah' mean, it's a dive bar.  They have beer, drinks, and show Warriors games on the tv.  What else can you ask for?

5 stars for ambiance! I loved this bar even though I went there with an okcupid date who never called me back. But despite that minor shitty detail... I absolutely adored this place! I love being near the beach and this is a perfect spot to grab a beer after a day surfing or staring at the sun. The servers were very nice and the crowd was your typical sunset crowd- mellow and super friendly. I loved that they had a fireplace and big wooden tables. They also have live surf rock and free nachos. And, it is very cozy and nice for a first date I might add. I'll definitely be back with better company!
my favorite bar in the city. almost hate to write a review for it as it to not get "spoiled" but its just an awesome local friendly bar.

Free chili and  nachos the night I went in on a cold night seeking a martini.  So that was super cool.  The cheese was the whiz kind too so it was so good yet so bad.Tables are all kinds of glazed wood shaped in one area.  Place is right by the beach and it has a fireplace that you can practically sit in.

Asian Persuasian, Caucasian, college girl tempations.. A beer and a half and I'm wasted. Thursday nights are poppin' make sure you're updated. Don't talk to tall whiteys who are sedated, might injure the medulla oblangata. Degraded.Once found a hotty, from Calcutta.Lots of mother lovers, I recall one, I think he's name was Danny Glover.   Rowdy boys spilled one on my sneaker, I gave them a fee waiver.White on white crime outside, entertaining as ever.A man walks into a bar, maybe never.Wild College days are over.

So I've always liked the riptide.... used to go there a lot long ago when I lived in the hood. But damn, the tatted up lady bartender was one of the most unpleasant people I've encountered in the service industry in a long long time... Life's too short, and there are too many good bars in SF, to put up with that.

I'm an old lady who went here last night with her boys and their friend.  It was packed.  A jazz quartet was setting up, and we found 1 stool for the old broad (me) and ordered drinks from the calm, efficient bartender, who was holding down the fort all by himself.  Drinks were very strong, well made, properly garnished, delivered with alacrity and a polite nod.  This bartender was so good, all he needed was eye contact to start another round.  There was a big table of boisterous ladies with their dog, folks were dancing to the great band, and much merry was made.  The one sad texter sitting next to me made a number of trips to the bathroom, drank a beer, and left, texting, fairly soon, delivering up another stool.  We spent a happy Sunday night at what I think is the best neighborhood bar I have ever had the pleasure of drinking in; and I've been drinking legally for 42 years.

I came here the Friday of Halloween weekend with three friends. Let me just say that the last time I was here, it was a Wednesday afternoon and I was one of 6 people in the place. Not so exciting. Fast forward to my last visit: We walk in at midnight--my friend just turned legal--costumes and all. The place was PACKED! So much life and noise! Deeefinitely a different picture than scenario #1. The bartender pulls out a full-page menu of special Halloween drinks, and we get on with business. (Which by the way packed a strong backward punch in me at the end of the night. Strong drinks indeed.)A little while later, we're posted up right at the bar, and everyone's throwing me compliments on my costume and wanting a picture. I'm not trying to gloat/brag/whatever you will, my point is that the crowd here is very friendly, sociable, approachable, amicable, I can keep going...It was a very comfortable alternative to our next night at a gay bar in the Castro where the same costume returned absolutely no compliments or photo requests, only questionable and/or judging looks that l understood only as "What the eff are YOU?" (Feel free to sue me for wearing the same thing two nights in a row. It was indeed a superb costume, and I was on a budget.)To sum up, The Riptide is the place to go if you want a fun crowd to surround your entourage, if you need an upbeat place to party solo after a bad breakup/shitty week, and the music is great. Not to mention the drinks are relatively inexpensive. The ATM was giving me some trouble, though, so bring cash before you go on your way.And for those that are wondering, I was Slash.

Have lived in walking distance to this place for almost 4 years and on ly just started coming.  There are good happy hour specials, pretty friendly folks (some patrons not so much, but whatever), and fun theme nights.  Have been for open mic monday, karaoke tues, and will definitely walk over there for other nights.  Great to know there's a place that cares about a little nightlife in our hood.  It's really the only one, and luckily it's pretty fun!
Great place to hangout near the beach!!  Ladies night on thursday is the absolute best! Check it out!!

I just saw the Cottontails (sp?) last night and really enjoyed myself! The band was so great, I was surprised that they did not charge a cover.  I love the authentic decor of the bar and the variety of patrons. I also really like that the bar is a U-shape so that the bartender can access more customers efficiently. Everyone was friendly and laid-back. Maybe more seating would be nice, but it is a little too small for more. I wish it was my local bar :(

As someone else wrote, it has good nights and it has bad nights. The dichotomy causes a tension that has motivated me to write this. Bad nights are when the bar is overcrowded with people barely legal, or when its so full of hipsters acting unwarrantedly elusive that you eat one of the Tides free hotdogs so you dont throw up from laughing. Curt waitresses most of the time. The boys/men are a little better at customer service. The glasses are filthy often: someone else's debri encrusted lip marks on that nice fresh Riptide Red you've been jonesing for all day and now, its sudsess-interuptus. Insanely unwarranted unfriendly pretention is sadly the 'Tides social benchmark, and yet the fireplace, surfer movies, wednesday's 7-11 quality nachos, and the days when there's a free table to write keeps the Riptide in the debate of "to be or not to be" in Sunset bars. Hipsters take note: The ironic thing about Irony is that it is self originating, it cannot be artificed. For a friendlier, more down to earth bar, with its own dirty glasses but a beef stew to die for go up the street to 4 Deuces. Just avoid the Irish activity nights if you dont have an accent...their picky about that stuff, and I dont blame them. No pretense except cocky young male stuff.

Yelp and I have an undecided relationship.  I am in the service industry and it can truly harm a server, bartender or owner of a bar/ restaurant establishment.  I digress.... Myself and 4 of my friends were at Riptide on 3/26/11 for late night drinks we made it just before last call  5beers nice tip though thru the whole process of ordering this petite brunette bartender acted as if we were the biggest inconvenience. We proceed to sit at a table and chat amongst ourselves which would have been much easier if Suzy Happy Pants wasn't hurling bottle after bottle into the recycling bin with such force it was ear piercing.  Last call is given, not even 7 minutes after she is at the table saying drink up let's go and literally grabbed the drink out of one of my friends hand.  Idiot!!! 5 Industry folks that will never go back and live in the hood!! Nobody killed your Damn Puppy!! Oh wait it gets better last night April 2 Gave it another shot heard there was a great band, and yes they were Fantastic!! People are hootin hollering and WHISTLING!! Yes little miss Brunette Bartender if you are reading this you know all about the whistling.  My friend was asked to leave the bar for whistling....??, yes I know my friend occasionally can be a pain in the ass. Tonight was not one of those nights, crowd was happy everyone getting along older crowd etc. etc.  Okay so he leaves does not put up a fight. He took the fall for myself and another woman who were showing a few individuals how we learned to whistle when we were kids.  Okay probably sounds pretty lame but that is the story.  The bouncer was going to pop a vein still talking about this with Suzy Happy Pants.  She makes eye contact with me so I tried to explain that my friend was not to blame and try to tell her the lame story....  Her ever so shitty rude response was well you better give me your drink and get out of the bar as well.  Again, I digress....Dearest Owner,That little bartender should be let go in this case, the biggest gripes from your yelp reviews are service.  Whether you are dive bar in the Sunset or the Ritz our money pays your lease, labor, inventory, insurance etc.  Having a bitchy mean girl such as that in your employ is outlandish.  Remember SF is a big place you never know who you are waiting on.

Could be better, could be worse. I've been there on the right night, and I've been there on the wrong night. The wrong night is usually a Friday or Saturday.  Some of the bartenders are awesome and friendly, some of them are rude. I'm glad it's close to home, because there isn't much else to do in this hood at night, but I won't come back to the Sunset for this place once I move downtown.

Cozy little dive.  Open mic night is pretty cool.  Get to hear the locals come in play a couple of songs, each.  Quite entertaining talent shows up, so that's a night worth checking out.  My cocktails were a bit on the diluted side, so next time I go, I'll simply get my whiskey neat.

I am conflicted.  I really like Riptide.  I like that its a dive, that they allow dogs, a good juke box, that they have cheap good beer and friendly bartenders.  I really  liked Bingo Saturdays, with a good friendly crowd that was there to chill and play with a beer.  Then I started noticing more and more people coming to Saturday Bingo, and I thought, ok, that's cool, you know, bigger bingo pot, more energy.  Then I noticed that many of the new people were rude, annoying, with drunk ex frat boys and hipsters or hipster wannabes to boot. Honestly, after this last Saturday, I think I'm going to take a break from Riptide. This Saturday reminded me of those annoying bars in the Mission and in the Haight that are super pretentious and where irony is a fashion requirement.  I know that this Saturday crowd swell may be good for the Riptide in the short run  in terms of income, but they could end up loosing some loyal customers who go there to chill, have a beer, and play the occasional game of bingo.

im partial to cozy dive bars.  i came in this afternoon for a lowkey daytona 500 viewing party.  i ordered a wodka bloody mary, and it was the breakfast of champions!she asked me if i wanted bacon in it.  "sure!"i had a lot happening in my pint glass.  the bacon was perfectly rippled and chewy and was nice soaked in the drink.  an olive, gherkin, onion and green bean were staked and good eating.  and of course the celery stalk.  it had a good peppery kick to it too, so i was set!  i ended up rocking out to guns and roses with a bunch of cool people i don't even know.  good times. good times.thanks for reading!

There was a violent fight here at the bar tonight and I feel that it was handled very poorly.  A guy smashed a beer glass into another guy's face (literally, the guy's face was bleeding all over).  There were tiny shards of glass all over (the floor, the tables, the chairs, my face not to mention).  I asked the bartender for first aid and all they gave me was a wet nap.  I had three small nicks on me from the glass, two of them on my face with a little dot of blood and no means of proper first aid.  Being that I am a calm person I didn't make a big deal out of it but I thought the situation was handled poorly.  Of course I am grateful that all I had was a few tiny nicks, but it could have been a lot worse.  They should hire a bouncer and they should have shut down the bar for the evening.  There were tiny pieces of glass everywhere.  I'm sure they violated a dozen health code rules.  Needless to say, I'm never coming back.
sailor decor, giant fireplace, across from the cold dreary lovely Pacific. sweet.

Eh, maybe it was just the experience I had but it seemed like a pretty typical bar. I'll do a review update when I go back with a group, but I went in with my old out of state ID and my new temporary California driver's license and the woman stood there for about 10 minutes contemplating whether to serve me. She finally decided to after asking if I was "a police officer or member of law enforcement". I felt a little awkward after that so I just left. One sketched out bartender!Looks like a good dive bar for the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way to be that deep in Outer Sunset at night.

This dive was written up in NYT recently, and I'll admit, upon reading about their Saturday Night Bingo games, this joint sky-rocketed to the top of my list. (I love me some Bingo!) We went on New Year's Day and it was a perfect low-key place to be post-NYE.$5 gets you a 3 Bingo cards and I think they play 3 rounds (we came late.) The give you "dobbers" for the last round (Black-Out!) which was fun. Who doesn't love Bingo dobbers!?The fireplace was quaint, and it was dog-friendly - always a plus in my book. The bartenders were very friendly and so was the crowd - which ranged from 20-something hipster girls, to 60 yr surfer-dudes, to drunk old Irish dudes with stone-cold glares. Definitely a local hangout.I wouldn't go out of your way to make this a destination for a wild Saturday night out, but definitely stop by for the Bingo! I'm going back and determined to win the pot!

It was open mic night and my friend performed here playing his own renditions of pop songs.  For example, Brittany Spears comes to mind and "You're the Best Around" from the Karate Kid.  I had a blast watching my friend but the other people that performed were ridiculously good.  I'm tone deaf and cursed them all as they left the stage.The beer selection was also decent.  I wish they would add Bass so I could get a proper Black and Tan.  They made it with Guiness and Anchor Steam.  Actually, not half bad.I would definitely go back.

I've only enjoyed this bar once in the many times i have gone. The one time i did enjoy the bartender was very nice and they had a fun band playing. Other times I've had the bitchiest bartender ever. I went recently and bartender was a super bitch as soon as we walked in the door. Then she made weak drinks for us. I dunno what was up her butt, because we did nothing to piss her off.

This place is okay for your neighborhood dive.And though I thought it was illegal, it's like, a dog-friendly bar too. There were 2 dogs there when I went on a Friday night. They said a lot more hang out during the day.The prices weren't amazing, but not bad. We got two beers and 3 shots of tequila. I'd say we were the hottest chicks in there.The hanging moose and crocodile heads were amusing.The ladies restroom was a Hepatitis-C level of disgusting.Yeah.

This is an amazing neighborhood dive bar. The inside looks like the bastard love child of a Captain's room on a ship and a surf shop. The bartenders are all friendly, and I have never felt harassed by any of the guys in the place. Overall a very relaxed, fun environment with great music. Note: I like to go on Thursday nights (Ladies Night) for the 1/2 off drinks.
